snippet: So far this year, banks have issued $33.5 billion in new commercial mortgage-backed securites, one of the structured financial products that stood at the center of the financial crisis. The mortgages within those securities are getting riskier.
lead_paragraph: So far this year, banks have issued $33.5 billion in new commercial mortgage-backed securites, one of the structured financial products that stood at the center of the financial crisis. The mortgages within those securities are getting riskier.
